newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ING joining Barings, international units.
newsitem.headline: ING joining Barings, international units.

text.p: Dutch financial services group ING Groep NV (ING) said on Tuesday it is combining its ING Barings investment banking unit with its ING Bank International corporate banking unit.

ING spokesman Ruud Polet said the two subsidiaries had been co-operating since the Dutch group bought British merchant bank Barings in March 1995 after it collapsed from derivatives trading losses in Asia.
"We are formalising now an organisational structure that was already practiced in our activities," he told Reuters.
He said the new name for the combined business had not yet been decided, but ING Barings would be logical.

Polet said all business units within the ING Corporate and Investment Banking executive centre would be combined as part of the process. A total of 9,000 staff are employed within these business units.

He also said the management structure of the combined business would change, with details to be provided on Thursday by executive board chairman Aad Jacobs at a news conference for ING's 1996 results.
